content.raw:
I also got a seg-fault after running the revolute_joint_test.world for about a minute. It occured when I opened and closed gzclient; I'm not sure if that's related or not. I have a backtrace:
~~~
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007f3271c02e08 in gazebo::physics::World::OnLog(std::basic_ostringstream<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >&) ()
   from /home/scpeters/local/lib/libgazebo_physics.so.1
#1  0x00007f32723d9270 in gazebo::util::LogRecord::Log::Update() ()
   from /home/scpeters/local/lib/libgazebo_util.so.1
#2  0x00007f32723d9c21 in gazebo::util::LogRecord::Update() ()
   from /home/scpeters/local/lib/libgazebo_util.so.1
#3  0x00007f32723da198 in gazebo::util::LogRecord::RunUpdate() ()
   from /home/scpeters/local/lib/libgazebo_util.so.1
#4  0x00007f32707d1ce9 in thread_proxy ()
   from /usr/lib/libboost_thread.so.1.46.1
#5  0x00007f3271339e9a in start_thread (arg=0x7f32413f7700)
    at pthread_create.c:308
#6  0x00007f326fb7acbd in clone ()
    at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:112
#7  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
(gdb)
~~~
content.html:
I also got a seg-fault after running the revolute_joint_test.world for about a minute. It occured when I opened and closed gzclient; I'm not sure if that's related or not. I have a backtrace:

(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007f3271c02e08 in gazebo::physics::World::OnLog(std::basic_ostringstream<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >&) ()
